CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 29, 1945, pg. 1, reads: "FOR DISTINGUISHED SERVICE - Motorcycle Patrolman Karl O. Jackson was awarded the Pittsburgh Police Department's Distinguished Service Medal as a result of his sensational eighty-mile-an-hour chase through city traffic to apprehend three alleged holdup men this week. Jackson had engaged in a similar chase two weeks ago.  Left to right: Mayor Cornelius Scully, Director of Public Safety Col. George E. A. Fairley, and Superintendent Harvey Scott. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Motorcycle police officer Karl Jackson receiving Distinguished Service Medal from Pittsburgh Mayor Cornelius D. Scully, with Director of Public Safety Col. George Fairley second from left, and Superintendent Harvey Scott on right, standing in the Office of the Mayor at the City County Building
